Posts.Content: Jul 8, 2010 03:05PM NYCntryGirl wrote: Hi, Cathy! I'm a Type 1 diabetic, too. I'm on an insulin pump. I was just diagnosed on June 10 with breast cancer and I'm recovering from my lumpectomy with axillary node dissection done on June 28. My primary worked out a sliding scale for me while I was under for the surgery and I programmed my pump with a temporary basal. If/When I needed insulin based on a BG, I got a shot; however, my BG were excellent and I only needed a bolus of glucose because one of my BGs was like 53. I'm not looking forward to how the different medications and side effects, as well as the stress, etc is going to play havoc with my BG, but as long as you surround yourself with a great team who know about the diabetes and are willing to work with you to take care of ALL aspects of your care, then you'll be fine. I doubt it will be easy - not that treating breast cancer withOUT diabetes is easy - but I have to believe that maintaining a positive outlook and working hard to be your own best advocate will serve you best in the long run. I'm here if I can help in any way. I know how difficult it is to find other T1 diabetics to talk to in conjunction with breast cancer. (You're the first so far for me...) ~Carey
